learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of schools as workplaces and be familiar with the statutory, ethical and other requirements that govern the work of teachers in schools. (APST: 7.1, 7.2)

Demonstrate the application of professional and disciplinary knowledge to engage with curriculum, pedagogy, assessment and reporting of student outcomes, and use this knowledge to design lesson plans and learning experiences. (APST: 2.1, 2.2, 2.3)

Create inclusive, supportive and intellectually challenging educational environments, and use a range of resources including ICT, and a range of teaching strategies that engage all learners, and set appropriate learning goals for students of all abilities and from broad range ofbackgrounds. (APST: 1.3, 3.1, 3.3, 3.4, 4.1)
Demonstrate a range of verbal and nonverbal communication strategies to support student engagement. (APST: 3.5)

Demonstrate skills of critical reflection to evaluate student learning and assessment data and make informed decisions regarding student learning and required modifications to teaching practices. (APST: 5.4)

Demonstrate skills of and purpose for critical reflection and engagement with APSTs, colleagues and mentors to identify professional learning needs and develop achievable plans for personal professional growth and effectively engage with constructive feedback through the stages ofpreservice teaching and beginning teaching. (APST: 6.1, 6.3)
Demonstrate clear, fluent, and coherent communication skills consistent with personal, professional and academic conventions.

Demonstrate all teaching and professional requirements of the professional experience placement. (APST: 1.1, 1.3, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.5,2.6, 3.1, 3.2,  3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 4.4, 4.5, 5.1 5.2, 5.4, 6.3, 7.1, 7.2)

assessments.assessment_title: AT1: Policies and procedures for professional experience
assessments.task_description:
This course requires you to complete a 20 day block (four week) supervised professional experience in a school.

To undertake this placement, you need to:

  1. read the School of Education’s Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience document.
  2. complete and submit the acknowledgement form in Blackboard, indicating that you have read this document and will abide by these policies and procedures while representing the University of Queensland on placement.

APST 7.1 & 7.2
assessments.submission_guidelines: Access and read the Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience document, then complete and submit the online acknowledgement in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: AT2: Professional experience & final evaluation report
assessments.task_description:
You are required to successfully undertake a 20 day block (four weeks) of supervised professional experience in the school assigned to you by the School of Education and upload your final evaluation report to Blackboard on completion of this placement.

You will be required to demonstrate appropriate teaching practice, building to full lessons and to sequences of lessons over the four week block, in specific teaching area/s. Structured observation continues.

You are expected to demonstrate competence across the APSTs. To do this, you need to demonstrate the inherent requirements of the role of a teacher. At the very least, this means you will be expected to:

  • attend the school at least half an hour before and after school start and finish times to discuss that day's and subsequent days' expectations
  • attend any meetings held during the time of the professional experience, e.g. departmental or whole of staff meetings, or any professional development meetings where attendance is approved by the school
  • participate in extracurricular activities, etc. available during the placement.

You need to have read and to abide by the UQ School of Education's Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience Placements, including attendance and completion requirements. Refer to this document for further information.

NOTE: all students are responsible for the collection and upload of their final evaluation report to Blackboard on the due date. Failure to upload your report may result in a failing grade for the course. Please do not assume that your teacher supervisor/s will forward the report to the university, or that UQ staff will upload the report to Blackboard.

APST: 1.1 and 1.3; 2.1, 2.3 and 2.5-2.6; 3.1-3.5; 4.1-4.5; 5.1, 5.2 and 5.4; 6.3; 7.1, 7.2 and if appropriate to the professional experience context, 7.3.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload your final evaluation report via Blackboard on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: AT3: Professional practice log & critical reflection essay
assessments.task_description:
Part A – Professional practice log

During your four-week professional experience, you are to keep a log of items collected, created, presented, modified or adapted, that could be used as evidence to demonstrate your fulfilment of Australian Professional Standards for Teachers (APST) Three, Four and Five from Domain Two: Professional Practice.

You need to use the professional practice log provided in Blackboard to record, annotate and map your chosen items against the specific standards and focus areas. 

You are required to record 5 items:

  • ideally, you should aim to include items that address multiple standards and focus areas
  • your annotation for each item should
  • be approximately 150-200 words
  • explain how the item demonstrates the identified focus areas, guided by the APST Graduate level descriptors.

You must attach your chosen items as appendices to your professional practice log.

Part B – Critical reflection essay

Write a 1000 word essay that critically reflects on the positive impact of your teaching on student learning from your four-week placement experience.

Focusing on the impact of your teaching does not imply use of evidence of student growth in response to jurisdictional or national standardised tests. Rather, the focus is on demonstrating your impact on student learning as a preservice teacher.

Evidence of your impact could take the form of a case study. It could include collection and interpretation of data at a student, classroom, school and/or systemic level, which you used to inform and then adjust your teaching practice to impact student learning. For example, you could analyse selected work samples from a student early and at a later stage in your placement or consult with a student of interest to inform your identification of learning needs, and then again at the end of your placement, to identify where learning or development occurred.

Some items collected in Part A should be linked to your response and used as evidence to inform and prepare your critical reflection.

You need to use academic literature to support your writing and APA7 referencing conventions. It is recommended that you use 6 to 8 sources throughout your response.

APST 3.1-3.5, 4.1-4.5, 5.1, 5.2 and 5.4
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload your submission via Blackboard by 2pm on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension request via myUQ system will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Part A: Personal development plan

Complete a personal development plan (PDP) that identifies your professional learning needs at this stage of the Master of Teaching (Primary) program.

Your PDP needs to use the PDP template provided in Blackboard to evaluate your performance and knowledge against the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers (Graduate level). 

Refer to feedback provided by your supervising teacher/s during placement to assist your evaluation (e.g. lesson feedback, final evaluation).


Part B: Critical reflection essay

Using your PDP, write a 1500 word essay that critically reflects on:

  • your performance during the four-week supervised professional experience, and courses you have covered in this program
  • where you need to improve your practice to better meet the learning needs of both you and your students.

You should also revisit the three professional learning goals you identified in EDUC7530, and identify and explain the:

  • ways in which your philosophy of teaching has evolved and changed since your first professional experience in EDUC7530
  • strategies you will put into place, before and during your final professional experience (EDUC7540), and how these strategies will enhance your practice.

Using APA7 conventions, you need to reference academic literature to support your analysis of your development and the ways in which you are seeking personal growth (e.g. consider theories on reflective practice, pedagogy, learning, etc.). Using 8 to 10 sources is recommended.

APST 6.1, 6.3, 6.4
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload your submission via Blackboard by 2pm on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension request via myUQ system will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Preparing for the course

In the course Blackboard:

  • view introductory videos and supporting resources
  • read the course profile, schedule and assessment tasks
  • familiarise yourself with course readings
  • post initial questions for your course coordinator to answer
  • introduce yourself and complete an initial teaching reflection and questionnaire.

Learning outcomes: L06

Aligning teaching, learning and assessment to the curriculum

Designing teaching, learning and assessment in Queensland from P to 12:

  • accessing, understanding and using the curriculum for teaching, learning and assessment design
  • quality assessment and the role of backward design
  • the role of assessment data in evaluating student learning and modifying teaching practice.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05, L07, L08

learning_activities.topic:
The teaching, learning and assessment cycle

Deliberate design — key theories and models for preparing and implementing:

  • teaching and learning plans
  • lesson sequences
  • lesson stages.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05

Iterative design, implementation, reflection and refinement

Deliberate design — applying key theories and models:

  • sample teaching, learning and assessment plans
  • the importance of preparation, monitoring, reflection, evaluation and revision
  • communities of practice and critical feedback.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07

learning_activities.topic:
Deliberate design: lesson planning and selecting resources

Designing teaching and learning over days, weeks and units — theoretical and practical approaches:

  • structuring and sequencing multiple lessons to the TLA cycle
  • the role of monitoring, formative assessment and providing feedback on learning
  • using supervisor feedback, critical reflection and reflexive practice to improve design and learning.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Deliberate design: lesson planning and selecting resources

learning_activities.topic:
Designing lessons and selecting resources

Explicit, directed lesson planning:

  • alignment to the curriculum
  • clear and achievable learning intentions and success criteria
  • staging to activate, develop and consolidate student's knowledge, understanding and skill building, with purposeful use of teaching and learning strategies and resources
  • use of ICTs, in ways that mitigate cybersafety issues and promote ethical and responsible use
  • evaluative feedback, critical reflection and revision.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L06, L07, L08

learning_activities.topic:
Designing lesson sequences and selecting resources

Deliberate design of lesson sequences to the appropriate stage of the TLA cycle that:

  • provide development and progression of students' knowledge, understanding and skills
  • purposefully use a range of teaching and learning strategies and resources
  • include and promote responsible and ethical use of ICTs
  • provide effective data on student learning and timely, actionable feedback for learners, aligned to the curriculum
  • use evaluative feedback, critical reflection and reflexive practice to improve design and learning.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08

learning_activities.topic:
Diverse learners and classroom cultures

Learner diversity and strategies to create and maintain safe and supportive learning environments:

  • legislative, school and employing authority requirements
  • ethical principles and practices in the teaching and learning process
  • use of the Australian Curriculum v9.0 learning progressions, of monitoring, feedback and assessment
  • differentiating teaching and learning, Universal Design for Learning and culturally-responsive pedagogies.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05

Deliberate teaching and learning design to meet the strengths and needs of diverse learners, including:

  • differentiating teaching and learning, Universal Design for Learning and culturally-responsive pedagogies.

learning_activities.topic:
Expectations and opportunities for professional growth

Bringing it all together for the AT2 — your supervised professional experience:

  • deliberate observation, design and implementation for teaching and learning
  • working effectively with your school and supervising teacher/s
  • your Final Evaluation Report.

Documenting your professional growth in the AT3 and AT4:

  • collecting evidence of student learning and teaching impact
  • maintaining a professional log and developing a PDP
  • writing critical reflections to task requirements.

Learning outcomes: L01, L06, L08
